intro: Labatia sambuensis, commonly known as the Sambu bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Labatia sambuensis typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
